summary: Jean-Baptiste Lully , , was an Italian composer, violinist and dancer who spent most of his life working in the court of Louis XIV of France.
full_text: Jean-Baptiste Lully  was an Italian-born French composer, instrumentalist, and dancer who spent most of his life working in the court of Louis XIV of France. He is considered the chief master of the French baroque style. Lully disavowed any Italian influence in French music of the period. He became a French subject in 1661.
title: Jean Baptiste Lully
